Detailed Description

Represents a language dependant map to translate key codes to symbols.

The keymap class stores the map used to translate key codes to key symbols. It is loaded from an XML file structured as follow: 

 <keymap>
     list of keys
 </keymap>
where list of keys is a list of <key> elements. Each key is recorded in a KeymapKey object.

The Keymap maintains a global modifier that is calculated from all the latched and locked modifiers.

Each key associates a code and a modifier with a symbol. The Keymap can be queried with getSymbol().

See also:
KeymapKey

Member Function Documentation

Keymap::addModifier ( quint8  mod  ) 

Adds a modifier to the global modifier state.

The global modifier state is used to retreive the symbol associated with the key. Use this function when a modifier key is pressed to make sure all future symbol queries will take this modifier into account.

Parameters:
mod The modifier code as returned by the getKeyModifier() function.
See also:
Keymap::getKeyModifier

Keymap::removeModifier

Keymap::getKeyModifier ( quint8  code  ) 

Returns the modifier value of the key code.

This returns the modifier value for modifier keys. For non modifier keys, it returns 0.

Parameters:
code The key code to query
Returns:
The modifier value assiciated with the key code
See also:
Keymap::addModifier

Keymap::removeModifier

Keymap::isLocker ( quint8  code  ) 

Returns true if the code is associated with a locker key.

Parameters:
code The key code to query
Returns:
true if the key is a locker key, false otherwise.

Keymap::load ( QString  file,
Settings *  settings 
)

Loads the Keymap from a XML description file.

Parameters:
file The file name of the XML keymap description.
settings The settings object used to instantiate the symbols.
Returns:
true for success, false for failure.

Keymap::removeModifier ( quint8  mod  ) 

Removes a modifier from the global modifier state.

Use this function when a modifier key has been released.

Parameters:
mod The modifier code as returned by the getKeyModifier() function.
See also:
Keymap::addModifier
